> > > If the warc.gz was generated using wget, (or possibly any tool
> othe=
r than Heritrix), it may be that the Wayback codebase can't
> understand it=
. I hit this with wget due to a specific issue with GZip
> fields (see http=
s://github.com/ukwa/warc-discovery/issues/1 for
> details). One way around =
it is to decompress and recompress using JWAT
> Tools (https://sbforge.org/=
display/JWAT/JWAT-Tools).
> > > > 
> > > > Note that I have also hit a simi=
lar problem with some compressed
> WARCs with the very latest 1.8.0-SNAPSHO=
T version of Wayback, although
> it's not clear if this is related to the f=
irst issue or not. (see
> https://github.com/ukwa/warc-explorer/issues/5 fo=
r details). Version
> 1.7.1-SNAPSHOT is currently the most reliable for me.=

> > > > 
> > > > Thanks,
> > > > Andy Jackson
